dkeep.logic

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • dkeep.logic.Game
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    class responsible for managing all the events in one level of the game.
    Author:
    Tiago
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private GameMap gameMap
      Stores all entities position.
      private Hero hero
      Reference to the hero, easier to move him.
      private static long serialVersionUID 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game(char[][] map)
      Main constructor of class Game, it creates a game using a multidimensional array (Might need some additions in case of overlaping enemies).
      Game(GameMap map)
      Constructor of class Game - this one is used for the levelEditor.
      Game(int x, int y)
      Creates a Game with only walls in the sides (used for levelEditor).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds the entity to the game.
      void addWinningCoords(dkeep.logic.Generic.Coordinate[] coords)
      Adds an array of coordinates to the list of winning coordinates (coordinates which, when stepped, wins the game).

      Checks if the hero colides with ogre (it is a complement of moveHero function).

      • getEnemies

        public java.util.HashSet<Entity> getEnemies()
        Getter that uses a gameMap getter - its is used in some cases, so it is avoided the get of the map. It returns all the enemies in the game (ogres and guards);
        Returns:

      • moveOgre

        public boolean moveOgre(Ogre ogre)
        Function that moves the Ogre randomly and also its club. Calls placeClub.
        Parameters:
        ogre -
        Returns:

      • placeClub

        public void placeClub(Ogre ogre)
        Used by moveOgre, moves the club randomly by using ogre's coordinate.
        Parameters:
        ogre -

      • moveGuard

        public boolean moveGuard(Entity ent)
        Moves a guard using it's walkpath. Also updates the guard position in the walkpath. Gives the guard the chance of deploying their events (sleep, and go backwards for example). Walkpath is always conveniently updated.
        Parameters:
        ent -
        Returns:

      • moveHero

        public boolean moveHero(dkeep.logic.Generic.Generic.Direction dir)
                 throws GameEndException
        Moves the hero. Also checks all collisions between the hero and the other entities. If the hero loses or wins the game in the movement, an exception is thrown with a boolean of the game ending (true if win, false if loss).
        Parameters:
        dir -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        GameEndException

      • checkHeroColisionWithOgre

        public void checkHeroColisionWithOgre(Ogre ogre)
                               throws GameEndException
        Checks if the hero colides with ogre (it is a complement of moveHero function).
        Parameters:
        ogre -
        Throws:
        GameEndException

      • updateGame

        public void updateGame(dkeep.logic.Generic.Generic.Direction dir)
                throws GameEndException
        Function responsible for advance the game, it moves both the enemies both the hero. It throws GameEndException in case of ending the Game
        Parameters:
        dir -
        Throws:
        GameEndException
